perturbation.original_text: Pursuant to and in accordance with the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the "Exchange Act"), and the rules and regulations thereunder, each party hereto hereby agrees to the joint filing, on behalf of each of them, of any filing required by such party under Section 13 or Section 16 of the Exchange Act or any rule or regulation thereunder (including any amendment, restatement, supplement, and/or exhibit thereto) with the Securities and Exchange Commission (and, if such security is registered on a national securities exchange, also with the exchange), and further agrees to the filing, furnishing, and/or incorporation by reference of this agreement as an exhibit thereto.
perturbation.changed_text: Pursuant to and in accordance with the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the "Regulations"), and the rules and regulations thereunder, each party hereto hereby agrees to the joint filing, on behalf of each of them, of any filing required by such party under Section 13 or Section 16 of the Regulations or any rule or regulation thereunder (including any amendment, restatement, supplement, and/or exhibit thereto) with the Securities and Exchange Commission (and, if such security is registered on a national securities exchange, also with the exchange), and further agrees to the filing, furnishing, and/or incorporation by reference of this agreement as an exhibit thereto.
perturbation.explanation: The term "Exchange Act" is replaced with "Regulations". It's unclear whether "Regulations" refers to the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 or some other set of rules, which introduces ambiguity and potential contradiction.

perturbation.original_text: This agreement shall remain in full force and effect until revoked by any party hereto in a signed writing provided to each other party hereto, and then only with respect to such revoking party.
perturbation.changed_text: This agreement shall remain in full force and effect until terminated by any member hereto in a written notice provided to each affiliate hereto, and then only with respect to such terminating member.
perturbation.explanation: Changing "revoked" to "terminated", "party" to "member", and "party" to "affiliate" creates confusion. Are these terms interchangeable? The legal implications of 'termination' vs 'revocation' can be different. Similarly, 'member' and 'affiliate' introduce uncertainty about the scope of the agreement and who can revoke it.

perturbation.original_text: IN WITNESS WHEREOF, each party hereto, being duly authorized, has caused this agreement to be executed and effective as of the date set forth below.
perturbation.changed_text: IN WITNESS WHEREOF, each signatory hereto, being duly authorized, has caused this instrument to be executed and operative as of the date set forth below.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing "party" with "signatory", "agreement" with "instrument" and "effective" with "operative" creates ambiguity. It is unclear if "signatory" means the same as "party" and if "instrument" has the same effect as "agreement". This introduces uncertainty about who is bound by the agreement and the legal consequences of signing the document.
